message.content: This question requires knowledge about the properties of light. When light hits a surface, it can bounce off or reflect, allowing us to see it. Option (C) is the correct answer because overhead signs are typically made of reflective material, such as metal or plastic, which allows the light to bounce off and be seen. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because these materials are not typically reflective and do not easily bounce light. A paper bag absorbs light, a pencil is not a smooth or reflective surface, and a cardboard box also absorbs light.

This question requires knowledge about the properties of light and how it interacts with different surfaces. When light hits a smooth and reflective surface, such as an overhead sign, it can easily bounce off and be seen by our eyes. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because paper bags, pencils, and cardboard boxes are not typically smooth or reflective enough to bounce light in a way that is easily visible.

This question requires knowledge about the properties of light and its interaction with different surfaces. When light hits a surface, it can be reflected, absorbed, or transmitted. Option (C) is correct because an overhead sign is typically made of a shiny, reflective material and will reflect light, making it easily visible. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because paper, pencils, and cardboard boxes are not typically highly reflective surfaces and would not bounce light in such a way that it can be easily seen.

This question tests our understanding of the properties of light reflection. When light hits a smooth, flat, and shiny surface like an overhead sign, it can easily bounce off and be seen by our eyes. Option (A) is incorrect because a paper bag is not smooth or shiny, so light would be absorbed or scattered rather than reflected. Option (B) is incorrect because a pencil is also not a smooth or shiny surface, so light would be absorbed or scattered. Option (D) is incorrect because a cardboard box is not smooth or shiny, so light would be absorbed or scattered.

This question requires knowledge about how light interacts with different materials. Light can easily be seen bouncing off of an overhead sign because most overhead signs are made of reflective materials such as metal or glass. When light hits these surfaces, it reflects off of them, allowing us to see the reflection. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because paper bags, pencils, and cardboard boxes are not typically reflective surfaces and therefore do not easily bounce light.

Out of the given options, overhead signs are typically made of reflective materials, such as metal or plastic, with smooth surfaces. Therefore, light can easily be seen bouncing off of an overhead sign. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they do not typically have smooth and highly reflective surfaces.

Options (A), (B), and (D) are made of materials that are typically not smooth or reflective, so light would not bounce off of them in a noticeable way.

Options (A), (B), and (D) do not typically have surfaces that are highly reflective, so light bouncing off of them would not be easily visible.
